title: ECG-Expert-QA: A Benchmark for Evaluating Medical Large Language Models in Heart Disease Diagnosis
author: Xu Wang (Shandong Jianzhu University), Jiaju Kang (FUXI AI Lab), Puyu Han (Southern University of Science and Technology), ...
relevance_why: This paper provides a comprehensive multi-modal dataset specifically designed for improving diagnostic capabilities in electrocardiogram analysis, which can inform development and evaluation of AI models relevant to Haohe Liu's interests in audio and signal processing.
background: The paper introduces a large dataset that combines real and synthetic electrocardiogram data for training and evaluating language models on heart disease diagnosis.
contribution: This paper introduces the ECG-Expert-QA benchmark to solve evaluation challenges in electrocardiogram interpretation, achieving a dataset with 47,211 diverse question-answer pairs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous datasets in the ECG domain lacked sufficient complexity and diversity for rigorous testing of models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances existing resources by providing synthetic cases that simulate rare cardiac conditions and incorporate ethical considerations in diagnostic tasks.

key_innovation: The integration of expert knowledge with language model capabilities to generate high-quality, clinically useful question-answer pairs focuses on real-world medical scenarios.
real_world_impact: This dataset could significantly contribute to AI-assisted healthcare by advancing the training and assessment of models used in clinical systems for ECG interpretation and diagnosis.
limitations: Challenges remain in ensuring the dataset accurately represents diverse patient populations and the implementation of quality control for continual updates.

new_terms.multimodal dataset: **Multimodal dataset** refers to a collection of data that includes multiple sources or types of data, such as text and medical images together.
new_terms.synthetic cases: **Synthetic cases** are artificially created data points that simulate real-world scenarios, aiding in expanding datasets where real examples are limited.

open_sourcing: The dataset is openly available at https://github.com/Zaozzz/ECG-Expert-QA.
